Reviews: Absolutely everything it says it is. It's quick, handles everything I need it to, the battery was surprisingly better than I expected. It's more than sufficient and all of the worries I had upon ordering were quickly laid to rest upon receipt. The video, speaker, speed, call reception, and otherwise overall performance were all very impressive for the delightfully low price of the device. Keep in mind that I'm coming from the impressive uses of a Samsung Galaxy Note 3. I was sick of paying an unnecessarily large phone bill and decided to bring my own device to a much more cost effective provider. (Works great with Cricket by the way)If I had ANY complaints (and I mean if I absolutely HAD to say something wasn't perfect) maybe I would just say that every once in a while, when my device is sending AND receiving too much information at the same time, sometimes I have to go to the quick settings in the notification bar and toggle my WiFi connection off then back on (by the way this takes less than 2 seconds) and to be honest that's because I tend to really push my phone. This only really happens when I'm trying to load a web page and someone just happens to be sending me a picture or something at the exact same time. When my page won't load, I toggle the connection (again, takes just half a sec) and then I see whatever incoming message was trying to push through as my page loads. And when I consider the ridiculously low price of such an otherwise top notch device, I think to myself, "I can definitely live with that." I am so happy with my device. I'm relieved to not have to pay expensive phone bills or device costs for such a wonderfully pleasing device on 4G service. I'm a serious power user who doesn't want to completely drain my wallet. And the cherry on top? It's an eye pleaser. Just saying. Phones can sometimes be like people: Great inside, not so pretty on the outside or vice versa. Not that it's the first thing I look for but it's nice to have a device that's just a pretty as it is functional. Definitely worth the price and I am very happy.

Product Name: BLU Studio 5.0 C HD Unlocked Cellphone, Black
Reviews: Got this phone for my girlfriend...from the image on Amazon, the color seemed more fuchsia, but in reality it's more hot pink. The phone itself runs very well so far, and it's easy to setup if you have experience with android phones. It comes with plenty of apps bundled and really not much bloatware. The package includes a charger, an earphone, a case protective cover, and screen protective cover. The camera takes pretty good pictures and has a lot of options. The phone runs smoothly thus far without any problems. My girlfriend does not game with the phone so I can't tell you if that would affect the performance of the phone. The phone comes installed with Kitkat OS. The phone also notifies you if you want to upgrade to newer version, but it seems to come up with a network error when I continued with the upgrade. So, not sure if the phone can be upgraded, since in other reviews some people are having trouble with upgrading the phone. Other than that, the sound quality is good, but could be better. The screen is vibrant and clear. Overall, a great phone for it's price and it's working out for my girlfriend. If you're looking for an inexpensive replacement, or an entry phone, you should look into this one.Update: My girlfriend had the phone for over an year and still loves it. For anyone else thinking of getting a BLU phone for long term use, an issue has arised that I think it's important to know. The screen on my girlfriend's BLU phone cracked by itself due to stress fracture over time. She did not drop her phone at all and had the case cover on. However, she did not apply the protective screen cover. The replacement touch screen is about $15, but the plastic touch screen is pretty thin. Not really worth it at this point since the phone still works well even with a large crack on it. For those thinking of getting the phone, just be aware of the plastic touch screen; especially if you are female and tend to tap the screen with your finger nail.

Product Name: BLU Studio 5.0 C HD Unlocked Cellphone, Black
Reviews: This phone is amazing for the price. You get 1GB RAM and 8GB storage. It is very fast and smooth. Keeps up pretty well on games. Has a truly beautiful HD screen. It runs nearly stock Android Kit Kat. There are no built-in Facebook, BLU or whatever apps.. It's so stock I had to get an app to play Windows Media Player files!It doesn't do LTE, but it runs 4G on AT&T network as long as you put your sim in slot 1. I use GoPhone. It has two full size sim slots. It had the right APN settings from the start. I've been using a Samsung Rugby Pro for my everyday phone, and the BLU seems to run the browser and apps faster. The micro usb charging/data port is on top, which is a little weird. Actually, it allows you to put your phone in a car cup holder while charging without turning it upside down. Not a big issue, but kind of convenient.The lock button is on the right side and volume rocker is on the left. The speaker gets pretty loud playing media, and the earpiece is just loud enough for phone calls. Wi-Fi and bluetooth connectivity are pretty good. BLU even sends you a screen protector, soft case, earbuds, usb charging cable and AC wall adapter.I really enjoyed this phone, until I noticed how quickly the battery drops off. If the phone is just sitting around idle, the battery holds up pretty well. Just checking email or web browsing will cost you significant battery life. Watching videos will drain it faster. I started the day out with 84%, and was down to 15% by 4 or 5 pm. I listened to Spotify for about a half hour in the morning, then listened to the music player for about 50 mintues on bluetooth headphones. The screen was off while I was listening to music of course. I didn't make any long phone calls, and I did a little texting.I know I'm not the first person to complain about the battery. It's a shame, because everything else about this phone is great. It will do everything you would expect out of a budget phone, and do it well. Just make sure you have a charger handy. If this phone had a better battery, it would be hard to beat.I'm going to try the newer model Studio 5.0 C with Android Lollipop and see if that does any better.{{ Update }} I tried the 2015 Studio 5.0 C with Lollipop. While it does have better battery life, it doesn't perform nearly as well as the 5.0 C HD. The new model also has a slightly smaller screen. I have returned both phones now. I wish I would have kept the 5.0 C HD! I'm seriously considering ordering it again. It is asking a lot of a $100 phone to perform well and have good battery life.{{ Update 7/2/15 }} I ordered this phone again, and I am very happy with it. I've been using it for a couple weeks now, and the battery issue isn't as critical as I had thought. If it's fully charged in the morning, it will last you all day with moderate use. I've gotten most of two days out of it a couple times. I would recommend it to anyone looking for a solid budget phone with a great screen.

It says that it's still connected to wifi and data, but it does not update anything. I don't get new hangout/facebook messages and I can't use the browser. It only begins to work once I turn off wifi and then turn it back on, and same with data. I'm guessing this is an OS problem and i'll see if I can try it with a custom rom.If the charging port on my Lumia wasn't broken, I wouldn't have switched to this phone. Product Name: BLU Studio 5.0 C HD Unlocked Cellphone, Black
Reviews: First, this phone is replacing a Nexus 5 with horrific disfigurements on its glass screen that rendered it unusable for daily use. This phone though, at its price point, is an absolute steal. BLU has really done something great by offering a price range for unlocked phones below the 200 USD mark. The packaging was clean and enhanced the phone's initial charm (the inclusion of earbuds, case, and screen protector were an absolute plus). Its version of KitKat (Android 4.4) is relatively stable with most popular apps I use (e.g., Strava and Instagram) and is bundled with useful apps such as a file manager, fm radio app, and a sim management app. One can't help but feel (from a U.S. consumer perspective) that this phone is ideal for international travel given the dual-sim card feature.Additional characteristics make this phone standout. The camera is surprisingly apt at taking pictures from both front and back (although there is some focus lag that users will have to be patient with). The colors on the screen are vibrant and the viewing angles are as BLU describes them on their product page. As many of the phones on the market today don't have a removable battery, the BLU 5.0 C HD was a breath of fresh (or old depending on how you look at it) air; I for one, cherish the fact that I can replace the battery with ease (and the micro SD card as well!). Battery life is standard for a phone with a screen this size, you'll get a good day's use out of it. I played a good amount of Monument Valley on this device and the performance was adequate, although at one point the phone's processor hit 68.7 C, which was of concern. For everyday use from a college student standpoint, this phone does it right.On a concluding note, phones such as this are a life saver; high-end phones will fall out of your hands and break and the cost of repair or replacement are burdensome. I scored this phone for below 100 USD thanks to Amazon's warehouse deals (it had been opened but not used). Truth be told I am clumsy with my mobile devices and the fact that this phone does everything I need it to do, yet if it were to break as a result of my tendencies I will not worry as much when replacing it with another BLU device, which I will definitively be considering for my next mobile phone purchase.

Product Name: BLU Studio 5.0 C HD Unlocked Cellphone, Black
Reviews: Just received this phone. Everything seems to work as it should. No issues at all. Pictures aren't bad at all. Wondering if folks complaining that photos are blurry removed the film covering the lens? Power drainage does seem a bit quick, but I installed an app killer to conserve battery and it's fine. Mostly using this phone for business and light social media, so not burning the battery by playing games (that is what my tablet is for).Edit July 31, 2015: So I've had this phone for a little over a week. Everything still functioning with no glitches or hiccups. The only complaint is that the vibration feature on the phone is weak. Unless I have it in my hand, I wouldn't hear the buzz or feel it in my pocket. Oh, I also noticed some blurry pictures. The camera tries to auto focus constantly, so if you have a shaky hand, your pics will blur. To remedy this, you can play around in the camera settings so that you don't leave it all up to the phone to auto adjust everything when taking pictures. In regards to the battery, I found that it drains faster if you toy around with the phone (swiping back and forth on screen, opening and closing apps), instead of leaving it alone while streaming something. For example, I would boot up a music app and a run tracker app for my exercise routine. The run app is known to be an energy hog. I would run for about 2 hours when the battery is at 98% and come home to check and it would be at 78%. That's not too bad. But! If I start playing around with the phone trying to upload my run log and check messages or emails afterward, I can lose 5%-10% battery life in 5 minutes. For this reason, I highly suggest getting a portable battery bank if you are considering to get this phone.

Reviews: My review is divided into sections based on things I want to comment about.UI: Nice, snappy, bright and clear display.BATTERY: Battery lasted a day with some usage, and some phone calls, at the end of the about 30% was still remaining. It is definitely performing much better than my expectations.Overall I am pleased with the phone and do recommend it if you don't have to pair it with Prius. But since I rely heavily on car's bluetooth connectivity, unfortunately it is not a keeper. It will be a great phone for my wife though. I'll pass it on to her.

Reviews: I ordered this phone six months after spending $200 on an Alcatel one touch because it erased my memory card and I would have to reboot it at least 8 times a day to get it to acknowledge my sim card. Reviews: This might be a nice phone but for me it has been the phone from hell. I purchased the phone with the intention of using it on the H2O wireless network as a pay-as-you-go phone. IT HAS NEVER WORKED as advertized to send either or both "text" messages [sms] or "picture messages" [MMS] messages. This is after at least 4 calles to 4 different customer service representative and one technical specialists from H2O wireless. While H2O has tried they just can't seem to get the right combination of settings to make everything work on their network. I do however give them credit for trying.If I use "messaging" [you know the green smiley face app] I can send text message and MMS messages but the MMS messages appear on my wifes Samsung Android phone as a video file not a picture file.If I use "Messenger" [the Google app] I can send text messages but I can't send MMS picture messages.And I haven't even tried to do a video chat using "Hangouts" yet to my grandkids which is another big WANT on my list of functions that work.At this point it seem I have about 2 options left.1. To try another pay-as-you-go cell phone providers SIM card and see if that works any better or;2. Just stop fighting this beast and return the thing to Amazon.It should not be this difficult to make a cell phone work. You should just be able to install a SIM card into a phone and it should work. In my case it has been two weeks of numerous phone calls and emails to both H2O and BLU [which has not responded in 3 days by the way] to people whose first language is most certainly not English. This of course complicates the difficulty of making the phone function. I sincerely hope no one else has these types of problems since this BLU phone is really a nice device.The decision I am facing is two fold. Do I try another cell provider [and their SIM] and just forget the $20 I have paid H2O or do I return the device to Amazon. Decision, decisions. Product Name: BLU Studio 5.0 C HD Unlocked Cellphone, Black
Reviews: *Just in case Amazon is combining reviews with other models, this is for the Blue Studio 5.0 C HD D535U, Yellow, for $119. This model is 8 GB storage with radio bands best for the United States with HSPA+ up to 42 MBPS speeds. The D534U is 4 GB storage with radio bands best for the United States with HSPA+ up to 21 MBPS speeds. The D534L has radio bands better for international countries. I'm not certain of the storage or data speeds.*For reference I am coming from 2 years use of a Samsung Galaxy Note 2 & 1 year use before that of a Samsung Galaxy S 2.*Responsiveness -I haven't noticed any lagging. Again, I bought the 8 GB. I have my Samsung Class 10 32 GB micro SD card installed. I would even say it's slightly more responsive than my Note 2. I don't do any gaming. I check email, browse the internet, shop, edit Google Docs & Sheets, etc, and of course make phone calls & send receive sms/mms.*Data speeds - If you're experiencing slow data speeds, do not rely on the automatically configured settings when inserting your SIM. Check with your carrier for the proper settings. My phone displays 4G. I have not noticed slower speeds compared to LTE on my previous phone. This may be due to the responsiveness of the processor.*Sound & volume - Speaker volume is just fine for calls. I don't have anything negative to say. For watching videos, I've needed to turn it down slightly.*Fits well in my smaller hands. It can definitely be used one handed with no modifications. Lighter weight.*Screen viewing for videos, texts, & pictures is fine. No issues. I was concerned about the slightly smaller screen from my Note 2 (5.5 to 5.0), but it's no adjustment at all.*Color is a neon yellow, not like a banana yellow, but not like glow in the dark neon. It's a nice looking phone.*Accessories - The box it came in is plastic & really nice. The case, headphones, & charger are all adequate. I installed the screen protector (bubbles underneath from dust but that's not Blu's fault) & it doesn't take away from the quality of the screen.*Keyboard - I did have to download the Google Keyboard from the Play Store to get gesture typing. Not a problem at all.*Camera - I use a DSLR for my main camera, but I do want my phone to have a capable camera. Lots of settings or just use auto scene detection. Definitely not as good as my sister's iPhone 6 & maybe not as good as my Note 2, but I would feel comfortable printing out 4x6 prints taken with this phone.*Durability - I dropped it on black asphalt the first day. I was very disgusted. Screen did not crack. I do see a small pin dot size chip, but I can't feel it when I run my finger over it. There is a black, plastic bezel around the screen which ended up with a minor chip that can't be seen when holding the phone at an arm length distance & can not be seen with the case on.*Battery life - I am not having the battery life issues others have had. I do plug it in when I'm home & not directly using it. There is battery left over at the end of the day, & I fully charge it overnight.*Bottom line - I just really can't find anything to complain about with this phone. I wasn't expecting much for $119 but I think it's as good as my Note 2 that costs me $550 2 years ago. My daughter is wanting a new phone when she heads to college in the fall. Her Samsung Galaxy S Relay has slowed down significantly even with 2 factory resets. I'm encouraging her to look into one of these instead of spending several hundred on another Samsung.

Product Name: BLU Studio 5.0 C HD Unlocked Cellphone, Black
Reviews: I have owned this for 4 months now and I am happy as a clam. Here are some features not mentioned in other reviews. There is a notification light that flashes green with notifications and turns Red when charging. The Blu phone updated it self the first day I used it. It updated the phone again 3 months later with new features. Glad to see Blu keeping their phones up to date. The camera takes pretty good pics. One surprise with the camera is that if you hold down the shutter button the camera will take about 22 pics in aburst mode. Cool. If you are in the Google user base you will find all your contacts, etc will sync with this phone. Also have all the apps in the Google play store. Voice commands are cool too. Just press the mic button on the home screen and say...set timer for 5 minutes, or what is the weather or set calendar appointment...again a nice feature. If you get this phone be sure to order the case made by Blu. There are 2 availible, a hard shell and softer shell cases that fit. Make sure you order the one that has the rear facing camera to the left and not center. There are 2 Blu phones that are similar but you need the one for the Blu Studio 5.0 C HD D534. The case fits absolutely perfectly. Wifi works great and locks on to weak signals if necessary. Another cool feature is a slight vibration when keys are pressed. Giving you a feel of definitely making contact with the screen. This can be turned off if you don't like taptic feedback. Phone quality is great and so is the speaker phone. Now the bad news...the battery needs to be bigger. If you carry this around and use it often or have Facebook eating up all those check-ins you may find that 8 hours of constant use will drain the battery to almost nothing. However, if you are a casual user you should get by on one charge. Personally if I am going to watch a movie on this I need to be plugged in with a charger. I found additional batteries are available for sale if you need more power. Also to clear things up, this phone uses the large sim card that was the normal size 4 years ago. No micro or mini sim here.PS: I have a pre-paid phone sim that I got years ago form 7-11 store that uses the ATT network. Unfortunately, there is not data plan available so all my internet is from wi-fi.

Product Name: BLU Studio 5.0 C HD Unlocked Cellphone, Black
Reviews: This phone is amazing for the price. You get 1GB RAM and 8GB storage. It is very fast and smooth. Keeps up pretty well on games. Has a truly beautiful HD screen. It runs nearly stock Android Kit Kat. There are no built-in Facebook, BLU or whatever apps.. It's so stock I had to get an app to play Windows Media Player files!It doesn't do LTE, but it runs 4G on AT&T network as long as you put your sim in slot 1. I use GoPhone. It has two full size sim slots. It had the right APN settings from the start. I've been using a Samsung Rugby Pro for my everyday phone, and the BLU seems to run the browser and apps faster. The micro usb charging/data port is on top, which is a little weird. Actually, it allows you to put your phone in a car cup holder while charging without turning it upside down. Not a big issue, but kind of convenient.The lock button is on the right side and volume rocker is on the left. The speaker gets pretty loud playing media, and the earpiece is just loud enough for phone calls. Wi-Fi and bluetooth connectivity are pretty good. BLU even sends you a screen protector, soft case, earbuds, usb charging cable and AC wall adapter.I really enjoyed this phone, until I noticed how quickly the battery drops off. If the phone is just sitting around idle, the battery holds up pretty well. Just checking email or web browsing will cost you significant battery life. Watching videos will drain it faster. I started the day out with 84%, and was down to 15% by 4 or 5 pm. I listened to Spotify for about a half hour in the morning, then listened to the music player for about 50 mintues on bluetooth headphones. The screen was off while I was listening to music of course. I didn't make any long phone calls, and I did a little texting.I know I'm not the first person to complain about the battery. It's a shame, because everything else about this phone is great. It will do everything you would expect out of a budget phone, and do it well. Just make sure you have a charger handy. If this phone had a better battery, it would be hard to beat.I'm going to try the newer model Studio 5.0 C with Android Lollipop and see if that does any better.{{ Update }} I tried the 2015 Studio 5.0 C with Lollipop. While it does have better battery life, it doesn't perform nearly as well as the 5.0 C HD. The new model also has a slightly smaller screen. I have returned both phones now. I wish I would have kept the 5.0 C HD! I'm seriously considering ordering it again. It is asking a lot of a $100 phone to perform well and have good battery life.{{ Update 7/2/15 }} I ordered this phone again, and I am very happy with it. I've been using it for a couple weeks now, and the battery issue isn't as critical as I had thought. If it's fully charged in the morning, it will last you all day with moderate use. I've gotten most of two days out of it a couple times. I would recommend it to anyone looking for a solid budget phone with a great screen.

Product Name: BLU Studio 5.0 C HD Unlocked Cellphone, Black
Reviews: Got this phone for my girlfriend...from the image on Amazon, the color seemed more fuchsia, but in reality it's more hot pink. The phone itself runs very well so far, and it's easy to setup if you have experience with android phones. It comes with plenty of apps bundled and really not much bloatware. The package includes a charger, an earphone, a case protective cover, and screen protective cover. The camera takes pretty good pictures and has a lot of options. The phone runs smoothly thus far without any problems. My girlfriend does not game with the phone so I can't tell you if that would affect the performance of the phone. The phone comes installed with Kitkat OS. The phone also notifies you if you want to upgrade to newer version, but it seems to come up with a network error when I continued with the upgrade. So, not sure if the phone can be upgraded, since in other reviews some people are having trouble with upgrading the phone. Other than that, the sound quality is good, but could be better. The screen is vibrant and clear. Overall, a great phone for it's price and it's working out for my girlfriend. If you're looking for an inexpensive replacement, or an entry phone, you should look into this one.Update: My girlfriend had the phone for over an year and still loves it. For anyone else thinking of getting a BLU phone for long term use, an issue has arised that I think it's important to know. The screen on my girlfriend's BLU phone cracked by itself due to stress fracture over time. She did not drop her phone at all and had the case cover on. However, she did not apply the protective screen cover. The replacement touch screen is about $15, but the plastic touch screen is pretty thin. Not really worth it at this point since the phone still works well even with a large crack on it. For those thinking of getting the phone, just be aware of the plastic touch screen; especially if you are female and tend to tap the screen with your finger nail.

Reviews: Absolutely everything it says it is. It's quick, handles everything I need it to, the battery was surprisingly better than I expected. The video, speaker, speed, call reception, and otherwise overall performance were all very impressive for the delightfully low price of the device. I was sick of paying an unnecessarily large phone bill and decided to bring my own device to a much more cost effective provider. This only really happens when I'm trying to load a web page and someone just happens to be sending me a picture or something at the exact same time. When my page won't load, I toggle the connection (again, takes just half a sec) and then I see whatever incoming message was trying to push through as my page loads. And when I consider the ridiculously low price of such an otherwise top notch device, I think to myself, "I can definitely live with that." I am so happy with my device. I'm relieved to not have to pay expensive phone bills or device costs for such a wonderfully pleasing device on 4G service. I'm a serious power user who doesn't want to completely drain my wallet. And the cherry on top? It's an eye pleaser. Just saying. Phones can sometimes be like people: Great inside, not so pretty on the outside or vice versa. Not that it's the first thing I look for but it's nice to have a device that's just a pretty as it is functional. Definitely worth the price and I am very happy.

Product Name: BLU Studio 5.0 C HD Unlocked Cellphone, Black
Reviews: First, this phone is replacing a Nexus 5 with horrific disfigurements on its glass screen that rendered it unusable for daily use. This phone though, at its price point, is an absolute steal. BLU has really done something great by offering a price range for unlocked phones below the 200 USD mark. The packaging was clean and enhanced the phone's initial charm (the inclusion of earbuds, case, and screen protector were an absolute plus). Its version of KitKat (Android 4.4) is relatively stable with most popular apps I use (e.g., Strava and Instagram) and is bundled with useful apps such as a file manager, fm radio app, and a sim management app. One can't help but feel (from a U.S. consumer perspective) that this phone is ideal for international travel given the dual-sim card feature.Additional characteristics make this phone standout. The camera is surprisingly apt at taking pictures from both front and back (although there is some focus lag that users will have to be patient with). The colors on the screen are vibrant and the viewing angles are as BLU describes them on their product page. As many of the phones on the market today don't have a removable battery, the BLU 5.0 C HD was a breath of fresh (or old depending on how you look at it) air; I for one, cherish the fact that I can replace the battery with ease (and the micro SD card as well!). Battery life is standard for a phone with a screen this size, you'll get a good day's use out of it. I played a good amount of Monument Valley on this device and the performance was adequate, although at one point the phone's processor hit 68.7 C, which was of concern. For everyday use from a college student standpoint, this phone does it right.On a concluding note, phones such as this are a life saver; high-end phones will fall out of your hands and break and the cost of repair or replacement are burdensome. I scored this phone for below 100 USD thanks to Amazon's warehouse deals (it had been opened but not used). Truth be told I am clumsy with my mobile devices and the fact that this phone does everything I need it to do, yet if it were to break as a result of my tendencies I will not worry as much when replacing it with another BLU device, which I will definitively be considering for my next mobile phone purchase.

Reviews: It's not as great as my old Lumia 810two major problems I'm experiencing with this phone:1. Low Battery life2. Wifi/Data constantly dropsBatteryThe Blu Studio 5.0 C HD has a 2000 mAh battery. Which I thought was a step up from my Lumia 810's 1800 mAh battery. Big mistake. When I begin my day with 100% charge, I can just leave it on and do nothing and watch the percent drop in a matter of minutes. If i leave if in my pocket with the screen locked and turn off wifi, and data, and all location services, AND have the phone running in "power saver mode" with the brightness all the way down, I find that it loses 5% charge in about 10-15 minutes. This is atrocious. I'm scared to watch what happens when I actually use the phone. When I do use it to the max, with a few apps running and wifi on, i watch it lose about 10% per 2 minutes. Yes the display is 720p but that shouldn't be a problem. The windows OS must use little power or something because my lumia could last me at least one and half days. Only now, after two years, it has begun to lose charge faster, but still can get a full day of use. The lumia has a smaller display coming at 4.3" and a really low res of 480x800 but it has a smaller batter too yet it still lasts longer than the Blu.WIFI/Databoth this phone and my old lumia 810 from about two years ago have up to wireless n and 4g hspa+ however, the blu studio 5.0 c HD constantly drops from the network. It says that it's still connected to wifi and data, but it does not update anything. I don't get new hangout/facebook messages and I can't use the browser. It only begins to work once I turn off wifi and then turn it back on, and same with data. I'm guessing this is an OS problem and i'll see if I can try it with a custom rom.If the charging port on my Lumia wasn't broken, I wouldn't have switched to this phone. I'm thinking of just getting the wireless charging shell for the lumia and a qi plate and then just using the blu only for the few android apps it offers that I need that I can't get on windows phone.
